answers.answer: Often the problem with wounds on diabetics is the poor blood flow through the arteries from the diabetes.   He does need to be careful to keep the area clean and avoid an infection.   He should try to use filtered water and an antibacterial soap is he can get one.   The wound vacs are great things for certain types of wound, and this is likely not to be one of those wounds.   Keeping the wound clean and controlling his blood sugar are the best things he can do.   A topical antibiotics such as silver sulfadiazine (SSD) would be helpful.
